content: PHP input in a field, as a formatter. I cannot seem to find this in backdrop. Has it been removed? (Compared to D7)

Ah, I found this. That is too bad. https://forum.backdropcms.org/forum-topic/need-php-filter-backdrop . While I agree it can open security holes, I feel it should be up to the site devs. So I guess Ill just have to work around it.
@Eric Vander Wal there might be a contrib module out there to help you with that

@Herb , thanks. I didnt see any, maybe I missed them. I am a bit of a PHP noob, but I was thinking to write a custom module that creates a block in code, and runs the PHP there. I am using the graphs module to create graphs from PHP rather than views.

While I agree that we probably don't want an official contrib module that allows someone to insert PHP into a filter, we could probably put something into the forum topic that allows you to create a block to do that.

I see there is a built in block called "Execute PHP
Dangerous! Execute arbitrary PHP code from a block. Requires the Execute PHP code permission." I didn't check in the existing blocks before.
I started writing a custom module for block display. My first module, so I might as well see it to the end however :)
Why does PHP abuse arrays so badly :P
That block is from the Devel module. It probably isn't generally available to all users without giving them dangerous permissions.
@oadaeh (Jason Flatt) , ah I see. Thank you. I did end up making it by code. Now I am sure I will have some code questions, lol.
